title: Nigerian leader canvasses efforts for polio-free status
text:
Abuja - President Muhammadu Buhari wants Nigeria to continue efforts to win certification as a polio-free country by 2017 after recording its last case in July last year, his office said on Tuesday.
"I want to reaffirm the commitment of the federal government to sustain the gains and momentum to enable Nigeria to achieve certification by 2017," Buhari told a meeting of state governors in Abuja late on Monday.
"I am, therefore, inviting you to join me in actualising this pledge, as experts have cautioned that the progress we have made in polio eradication efforts is still very fragile and that there is the risk of gains reversal if we don't sustain this great effort," he said.
Buhari said the country must sustain its zero polio case status, strengthen surveillance to quickly detect any case of polio, improve routine immunisation coverage and provide the needed human and material resources.
